sentences.english: Standing beside the mighty river, I am very thrilled.
sentences.chinese: 我站在浩浩的江水旁，心潮澎湃。

sentences.english: A cavity blood, nowhere to flow, an upsurge of emotion, such as surge.
sentences.chinese: 一腔热血，无处可流，心潮澎湃如波涌。

sentences.english: At this moment, Ms Ling Xiaoming contemplated a lot.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，凌晓明的内心更是心潮澎湃。

sentences.english: The teacher soon whipped the students into a fever of excitement.
sentences.chinese: 老师很快就把学生煽动得心潮澎湃。

sentences.english: Blood categories, that is, to let people are so excited excited mean.
sentences.chinese: 热血类，即为让人心潮澎湃，激动的意思。

sentences.english: For years Sweden has made lefties swoon.
sentences.chinese: 多年以来，瑞典一直令左翼分子心潮澎湃。

sentences.english: I am about to commit to one of the biggest emotional adventures in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我即将经历我人生当中一个最令人心潮澎湃的奇遇。

sentences.english: It was such a grand view that it aroused strong emotion in us sightseers.
sentences.chinese: 景色如此壮观，令我们这些游客心潮澎湃。

definition: to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
lit. blood vessels swell wide (idiom)/fig. one's blood runs quicker/to be excited
cannot control oneself (idiom)/to be beside oneself
to be fascinated/to be rapt/to long for/to dream of
